title: Lauren Liao
text:
I’m currently a Biostatistics PhD Candidate at University of California, Berkeley. My research focuses on improving causal design and analysis to address epidemiological problems. I have the privilege being co-advised by Dr. Samuel D. Pimentel and Dr. Alejandro Schuler.

Outside of work, I enjoy creating art, spending time with friends, and strumming on the ukulele.


Recent news









Sept. 2023

My paper on investigating Who is most at risk of dying if infected with SARS-CoV-2? on BMJ Open is available online!


Aug. 2023

I will be presenting a poster at Joint Statistical Meeting 2023 in Toronto and giving a talk at RAND Center for Causal Inference 2023 Symposium!

Thank you to SFASA for the Student Travel Award and making JSM travel possible!!


June 2023

My paper on analyzing randomized trials with prognostic scores is LIVE on arXiv now!





About this website: This website is built with Quarto, Github Pages, and is inspired by Melody Y. Huang’s website and followed Quarto tutorial by Samantha Csik.
